newsitem.title: INDIA: India panel recommends more aggressive PSU selloff.
newsitem.headline: India panel recommends more aggressive PSU selloff.

text.p: India's Disinvestment Commission has recommended that the government take in more revenue from the sale of shares in profit-making state-controlled firms, its chief said on Thursday.

Disinvestment Commission chairman G.V. Ramakrishna said the panel had also recommended that the drain on the federal budget from loss-making public sector enterprises (PSUs) should be eliminated as quickly as possible.
Ramakrishna spoke to reporters after submitting his commission's report to Industry Minister Murasoli Maran.

"We have said you should look into both profit-making and loss-making PSUs, then see that the draught on the budget on account of loss-making PSUs should be eliminated as quickly as possible," Ramakrishna said.
"Also increase the income for the exchequer from the sale of shares in the profit-making PSUs. It has to be a balanced approach," he said.
Ramakrishna said the commission recommended that PSU employees' interests should be protected.
He said Maran agreed to look into the commission's recommendations and to take an early decision.
Ramakrishna was scheduled to hold a news conference on the commission's report later on Thursday.
